revised_title: Observations on the Figure of Saturn and its Comparison with Jupiter
tldr: Dr. William Herschel observed the planet Saturn and found it to have a unique flattened shape at the poles. He compared Saturn's shape to that of Jupiter and found differences in their figures. He also measured the dimensions of Saturn's figure and provided a corrected drawing. These observations may help understand the matter in Saturn's ring and the effect of gravity on planetary figures.
